function.description: Traverse a directory looking for files that match a pattern in the style of the unix find command

directory.description: The directory to search in. The current directory "." will be used as the default if no argument is passed

pattern.description: The file pattern to look for. The pattern is a traditional unix glob format with * matching any character and ? matching a single character

tool.instructions:
Generate a readme that gives a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory.
Each entry should be a include a link to the referenced file.

content.text:
# Consolidated Summary of GPT Files

## [testdata/Bob/test.gpt](testdata/Bob/test.gpt)
The GPTScript file contains a script that uses a tool named "bob". The script demonstrates how to ask Bob a question ("how are you doing") and then repeat his reply exactly. The technique being demonstrated is the use of a predefined response format for a specific question.

## [testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt](testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt)
The GPTScript file contains a script that uses a tool named "bob". The script asks Bob "how are you doing" and repeats his reply exactly. The technique demonstrated here is how to interact with a predefined tool (Bob) by passing a question and receiving a response.

## [testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt](testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt)
The GPTScript file contains instructions to generate a README that provides a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory. Each entry in the README should include a link to the referenced file. The script uses tools such as `sys.find`, `sys.read`, and `summary` to accomplish this task. The technique demonstrated is the automation of documentation generation by summarizing the contents of multiple files and compiling them into a single README file.

tool.instructions:
Generate a readme that gives a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory.
Each entry should be a include a link to the referenced file.

content:
# Consolidated Summary of GPT Files

## [testdata/Bob/test.gpt](testdata/Bob/test.gpt)
The GPTScript file contains a script that uses a tool named "bob". The script demonstrates how to ask Bob a question ("how are you doing") and then repeat his reply exactly. The technique being demonstrated is the use of a predefined response format for a specific question.

## [testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt](testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt)
The GPTScript file contains a script that uses a tool named "bob". The script asks Bob "how are you doing" and repeats his reply exactly. The technique demonstrated here is how to interact with a predefined tool (Bob) by passing a question and receiving a response.

## [testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt](testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt)
The GPTScript file contains instructions to generate a README that provides a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory. Each entry in the README should include a link to the referenced file. The script uses tools such as `sys.find`, `sys.read`, and `summary` to accomplish this task. The technique demonstrated is the automation of documentation generation by summarizing the contents of multiple files and compiling them into a single README file.
